author: felixweber
title: Community Advisor Improvements
description: Os Conselheiros Comunitários são um papel chave em evolução do Projeto Catalisador e precisam de um lugar e orçamento para apresentar propostas para melhorar seu desempenho

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

This proposal influences all three strategic goals of Fund 8: grow the number of contributors, make Cardano an open-source project, and grow the dev and app ecosystem. The reason for that is that Project Catalyst is the key influencer of funding for all of the initiatives in the ecosystem. Without the ability to effectively organize and scale the work of community advisors, the Catalyst process can break. Moreover, with each fund Project Catalyst intends to onboard and integrate the more and more contributors. 
Even though that Catalyst scales rewards for the CA community proportional to the budget, the tools that CAs and VCAs use might not scale that well, creating a lot of frustration and inefficiencies.

Out of my personal experience as a CA, the community needs better tools to support the process and scale it to the new highs.

My rating is 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Catalyst community has many talented developers, moreover the CA community is skilled to provide feedback and name the opportunities for improvement. Moreover, the CA community has already developed some of the tools improving the review process. All of the above makes the initiative feasible.

At the same time, the proposal would be stronger if it:
1) provided an analysis of key pain points for the CA community.
2) shared some recent success stories, to provide insights into the impact and the cost of development of new tools.
3) explained why the requested budget of $100k is sufficient to fix all key pain points.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of specific use cases requiring attention.
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q2:
The defined metrics (the number of tools, the number of proposals) can only track the activity related to the iniative, but they won't provide insights with regards to progress towards the underlying objective: making the Catalyst process more efficient and scalable.

It can be worth to consider some of the following metrics:
1) the average time it takes to assess one proposal leveraging all available tools and best practices.
2) the % of assessments rated as "excellent".
3) capacity - the number of quality assessments that CA community can provide in one week.
4) the satisfaction of the CA community with the existing tools.
5) the satisfaction of the catalyst community with the CA work.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: The increase in the number of Catalyst proposals makes it critical to keep a good quality and efficiency for community advisor activity, as their number may not grow accordingly. I strongly agree that this challenge is critical for Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
This topics has received many good quality proposal in the past, and the Community Advisor Telegram channel is a place of creativity showing that the community does not lack ideas and talents. Challenge Direction give proposer a good point to start thinking.
